availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund R. Farrow (Caldwell co, kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Kenaz Farrow and Susan French Farrow. Married to Elizabeth "Betty" B. Henry Farrow in Woodford County, Kentucky, on February 26, 1850. Father of William Farrow, Bettie Farrow, Beckham Farrow, Molly Farrow, and French Farrow. Farmer in Montgomery County in July 1850. Resident in Woodford County in August 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 13B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 435A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 35.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 83.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320, 1850.
"Edmund R Farrow (1826-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #205121146, accessed June 30, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/205121146.
